---
title: "Plotathon"
author: "Isaac Quintanilla Salinas"
format: 
  revealjs:
    touch: false
    controls: true
    pointer:
      pointerSize: 32
    incremental: false
    slide-number: true
    css: styles.css
knitr:
  opts_chunk: 
    echo: true
    eval: false
    message: false
    warnings: false
    comment: "#>" 
revealjs-plugins:
  - pointer
filters: 
  - reveal-header
  - code-fullscreen
  - reveal-auto-agenda
---



## Website

[https://www.inqs.info/p/plotathon/f24.html](https://www.inqs.info/p/plotathon/f24)

# Installation

## Installing R

<https://cloud.r-project.org/>

## Installing RStudio

<https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/>

## Installing RTools (Windows)

<https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/>

## Posit Cloud

<https://posit.cloud/>

# R Packages

## Tidyverse



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("tidyverse")
```
:::



## Plotly



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("plotly")
```
:::



## ggthemes



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("ggthemes")
```
:::



## Esquisse



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("esquisse")
```
:::



## Load Packages



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(ggthemes)
library(esquisse)
```
:::



# R Projects

## R Projects

R Projects are designed to contain all your data, scripts, and output in one location. This ensures that things are compatible on other computers.

## Directories (Folders)

-   data

-   output

-   scripts

# RStudio Layout

## RStudio Layout

-   Scripts

-   Console

-   Environment

-   Files

-   Everything else

# Scripts

## Adding Script

-   Use the top right corner

# Loading Data

## Downloading Data Data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
u <- "https://www.inqs.info/p/plotathon/owenWilsonWows.csv"
basename(u)
download.file(u,
              file.path(getwd(), "data", basename(u)))
```
:::



## Loading Data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds <- read_csv("data/owenWilsonWows.csv")
```
:::



# Plotting

## Base Plot



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) 
```
:::



## Histogram



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_histogram()
```
:::



## Box Plot



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_boxplot()
```
:::



## Density Plot



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_density()
```
:::



## Box Plot By Category



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie, y = era)) +
  geom_boxplot()
```
:::



## Density Plot By Category



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie, color = era)) +
  geom_density()
```
:::



## Scatter Plot



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_point()
```
:::



## Scatter Plot by Group



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie, color = era)) +
  geom_point()
```
:::



## Add Regression Line



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = F)
```
:::



## Smooth Line



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(se = F)
```
:::



## Regression Lines by Group



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie,
                  color = era)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = F)
```
:::



# Esquisse

# Resources

## Resources

[R Graphics Cookbook](https://r-graphics.org/)

[R Graph Gallery](https://r-graph-gallery.com/)

[R Charts](https://r-charts.com/)

[ggplot2](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/)

[Graphical Data Analysis in R](http://www.gradaanwr.net/)

[Modern Data Visualization](https://rkabacoff.github.io/datavis/)

## Tidy Tuesday

Tidy Tuesday is a weekly data visualization challenge from the [Data Science Learning Community](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday).

Also check out my attempts at tidy tuesday: <https://www.inqs.info/ttw>

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
